page.title: 07FARMING IN STOCKLINCH
page.content: The largest farm in Stocklinch has 130 acres of pasture & 70 acres of arable land.It has 126 cattle.There are 2 smaller farms each under 100 acres. One rears cattle & the other sheep & pigs. In Stocklinch,all land is rented from an individual or the Ilchester Charitable Trust.Some fields have never been enclosed & 2 farms show fields on the hill slopes with boundary stones indicating the different owners. There would appear to be an increase in sheep rearing & the wheat acreage is high on the larger farms.This is probably due to the reduced quotas for milk production, & the grant of subsidies on wheat-a reflection of European Economic Community policy.
